info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, Mitchell and northern Yancey Counties through 1045 PM EST... At 1000 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Greeneville to 11 miles northwest of Marshall to 15 miles east of Gatlinburg. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burnsville, Marshall, Mars Hill, Hot Springs, Bakersville, Buladean, Bandana, Ramseytown, Green Mountain and Swiss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
